column4: can someone help me out? I plugged in my usb and it's not showing up I want to format the usb stick completely
does the partition show in the output of: sudo fdisk -l
no but then in ubuntu it just says GENERIC STORAGE DEVICE
can yuo access and format it if you run: gksudo gparted
I tried it but it doesn't show up in gparted
does: dmesg | tail -n 15    show the kernel detecting the insertion?
it does show up
does it mention any drive references or partitions?
let me try reinserting it
all it does is mention sdb
ok then if you run: sudo fdisk /dev/sdb
has the stick ben in a windows system?
no
good
unable to open /dev/sdb
ok can you fsck the drive ?
No medium found while trying to open /dev/sdb
ok what else can I do?
I actually feel like doing a dd if=/dev/zero to /dev/sdb
verify the name is the right on (so you dont screw your own data then go for it ;)
weird dd said "No medium found"
I can't even dd, my sdcard is 4G, but then this operation stops at 1.6GB
